Facts: 
> Land: Covering less than 2% of the Earth's surface area, rainforests are home to 50% of the Earth's plants and animals. At the current rate of tropical forest loss, 5–10% of rainforest species will be lost per decade. 
> Sea: Coral reefs are critical to maintain ocean's entire ecosystem. As more carbon dioxide enters the ocean from practices like overfishing, fishing using cyanide and dynamite, etc. 75% of remaining coral reefs are currently threatened, and many have already been lost. 
> Air: Giant livestock farms (aka "Factory Farms) contribute to the release of concentrated amounts of toxic gases into the air such as ammonia and hydrogen sulfide, which can travel for hundreds of miles. They also release methane into the air (a greenhouse gas), which causes a "rotten egg" smell. 

Easy ways you can help:  

> Reduce paper usage: tote reusable grocery bags, make used envelopes scrap paper, craft homemade cards from old magazines, get off the mailing lists of catalogs, etc. 
> Eat fish and meats consciously and from sustainable sources. Better yet, consider reducing your intake of animal products entirely!
